'''Kornelia Stoiber''' is a [[Wikipedia:Computer_scientist|computer scientist]] from [[Wikipedia:Austria|Austria]] who studied at a variety of universities and won a [https://ocg.at/fp-fh national IT incentive award]. In addition, she took courses in [[Wikipedia:Design|design]] and playing the [[Wikipedia:clarinet|clarinet]].<ref>{{Cite web
|title=Kornelia Stoiber on Beacons
|url=https://beacons.ai/kornelia.stoiber
|access-date=2024-10-05
|website=Beacons
|language=en
|url-status=live}}</ref>

'''Books:''' This user is currently reading the book [[Wikipedia:Patriot_(book)|"Patriot: A Memoir"]] by [[Wikipedia:Alexei_Navalny|Alexei Navalny]].

'''Videos:''' This user's favourite video is currently [https://youtube.com/watch?v=7aa_ik_UYTw "The 100,000 Qubit Quantum-Centric Supercomputer of 2033"] by [[Wikipedia:IBM_Research|IBM Research]].

'''Music:''' This user's favourite performance extracts are currently from the [[Wikipedia:Concerto_in_F_(Gershwin)|Gershwin Concerto in F]] [https://facebook.com/share/v/kHrnenbcALnmJwmb on Facebook] and [https://instagram.com/p/CXwNSXosiF_ on Instagram], performed by [[Wikipedia:Yuja_Wang|Yuja Wang]] and [[Wikipedia:Michael_Tilson_Thomas|Michael Tilson Thomas]] together with the [[Wikipedia:London_Symphony_Orchestra|London Symphony Orchestra]].

'''Infos:''' More information is available on the [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia|Wikipedia]] user page [[Wikipedia:User:KorneliaStoiber|User:KorneliaStoiber]] and on the [[Wikipedia:Wikimedia_Commons|Wikimedia Commons]] user page [[Commons:User:KorneliaStoiber|User:KorneliaStoiber]].

* The important thing is not to torment yourself with anger, hatred, fantasies of revenge, but to move instantly to acceptance. That can be hard.<br>''Russian:'' Главное – не терзать себя гневом, ненавистью, и фантазиями о мести. А мгновенно прийти к принятию. Это может быть очень непросто.
** Navalny, A. (2024). Patriot: A Memoir. United States: Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group. [https://www.google.at/books/edition/Patriot/vXr_EAAAQBAJ "Patriot: A Memoir" by Alexei Navalny on Google Books].<br>''Russian:'' Из книги Алексей Навальный "Патриот" (2024).

*** added quote<br>[[User:KorneliaStoiber#top|KorneliaStoiber]] ([[User talk:KorneliaStoiber#top|talk]]) 03:35, 28 October 2024 (UTC)

* What are the chances that I'll survive this morning? I don't know; six out of ten? Eight out of ten? Maybe even ten out of ten? It's not that I'm trying not to think about it, closing my eyes and pretending the danger doesn't exist. But one day I simply made the decision not to be afraid. I weighed everything up, understood where I stand – and let it go.<br>''Russian:'' Какие шансы у меня выжить сегодня утром? Не знаю: шесть из десяти или восемь из десяти. А может, и всё десять, Дело не в том что я стараюсь об этом не думать, зажмуриваюсь и делаю вид, что опасности не существует, – просто однажды я принял решени не бояться. Я всё взвесил, понял и отпустил.
** Navalny, A. (2024). Patriot: A Memoir. United States: Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group. [https://www.google.at/books/edition/Patriot/vXr_EAAAQBAJ "Patriot: A Memoir" by Alexei Navalny on Google Books].<br>''Russian:'' Из книги Алексей Навальный "Патриот" (2024).
** [[Alexei Navalny]] on [[Wikipedia:Wikiquote|Wikiquote]].
